# GitHub Configuration Guide

This directory contains configuration files and guides to improve the repository's visibility and maintainability.

## üìã Files Overview

### Automation & Workflows
- `workflows/` - GitHub Actions workflows for CI/CD
- `ISSUE_TEMPLATE/` - Issue templates for bug reports and feature requests
- `PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md` - Pull request template

### Visibility & Community
- `FUNDING.yml` - Sponsorship configuration (enables "Sponsor" button)
- `TOPICS.md` - Suggested repository topics for better discoverability
- `SOCIAL_MEDIA_GUIDE.md` - Complete guide for promoting the repository
- `README.md` - This file

## ‚úÖ Setup Checklist

Use this checklist to ensure all visibility features are configured:

### Repository Settings

- [ ] **Description**: Set a clear, keyword-rich description
  - Go to: Settings ‚Üí About section
  - Suggested: "Production-ready Docker template for Magento 2 with FrankenPHP - modern PHP application server with automatic HTTPS, high performance (~2500 req/s), and complete dev stack"

- [ ] **Topics**: Add relevant tags (see `TOPICS.md`)
  - Go to: Settings ‚Üí About section ‚Üí Topics
  - Add: magento2, frankenphp, docker, php, etc.

- [ ] **Template Repository**: Enable template feature
  - Go to: Settings ‚Üí General
  - Check: "Template repository"

- [ ] **Social Preview**: Upload a social preview image
  - Go to: Settings ‚Üí General ‚Üí Social preview
  - Recommended size: 1280x640px
  - See `SOCIAL_MEDIA_GUIDE.md` for design ideas

- [ ] **Features**: Enable key features
  - ‚úÖ Issues
  - ‚úÖ Discussions
  - ‚úÖ Preserve this repository
  - ‚¨ú Wiki (optional)
  - ‚¨ú Projects (optional)

### Community Files

Check that these files exist in the root:
- [x] README.md
- [x] LICENSE.txt
- [x] CONTRIBUTING.md
- [x] CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
- [x] SECURITY.md
- [x] SUPPORT.md
- [x] CITATION.cff
- [x] SHOWCASE.md

### GitHub Features

- [ ] **About Section**: Complete all fields
  - Description ‚úì
  - Website URL
  - Topics ‚úì
  - License: MIT ‚úì

- [ ] **Discussions**: Enable and organize categories
  - Q&A
  - Ideas
  - Show and Tell
  - General

- [ ] **Releases**: Create releases for major versions
  - Use semantic versioning
  - Include release notes
  - Attach binaries if applicable

- [ ] **Projects**: Set up project boards (optional)
  - Roadmap
  - Current Sprint
  - Backlog

## üéØ Visibility Improvements

### Quick Wins

1. **Add Social Preview Image**
   - Creates visual appeal when shared
   - See `SOCIAL_MEDIA_GUIDE.md` for design

2. **Complete Repository Topics**
   - Improves GitHub search ranking
   - Use all relevant tags from `TOPICS.md`

3. **Enable GitHub Discussions**
   - Builds community
   - Reduces issues for questions

4. **Create First Release**
   - Shows project maturity
   - Enables changelog tracking

### Regular Tasks

1. **Update Documentation**
   - Keep README badges current
   - Update version numbers
   - Add new features to docs

2. **Engage Community**
   - Respond to issues promptly
   - Acknowledge PRs
   - Feature community contributions

3. **Share Updates**
   - Post on social media
   - Write blog posts
   - Create video tutorials

4. **Monitor Analytics**
   - Check traffic statistics
   - Review popular content
   - Identify improvement areas

## üìä Analytics & Monitoring

### GitHub Insights

Access repository insights at:
`https://github.com/CleatSquad/magento-frankenphp-template/pulse`

Monitor:
- Traffic (views, clones)
- Contributors
- Commits activity
- Popular content
- Referring sites

### Docker Hub Analytics

Check Docker Hub metrics:
`https://hub.docker.com/r/mohelmrabet/magento-frankenphp`

Monitor:
- Pull counts
- Star ratings
- Tag popularity

## üöÄ Promotion Strategy

### Phase 1: Foundation (Week 1)
- [x] Complete all repository settings
- [x] Add all community files
- [x] Create comprehensive documentation
- [x] Set up automation

### Phase 2: Awareness (Week 2-4)
- [ ] Write announcement blog post
- [ ] Share on social media
- [ ] Submit to relevant subreddits
- [ ] Post on Dev.to

### Phase 3: Growth (Month 2+)
- [ ] Create video tutorials
- [ ] Write advanced guides
- [ ] Feature community projects
- [ ] Regular updates and engagement

### Phase 4: Community (Ongoing)
- [ ] Respond to issues/PRs
- [ ] Engage in discussions
- [ ] Share success stories
- [ ] Recognize contributors

## üí° Tips

1. **Be Consistent**: Regular updates keep the community engaged
2. **Quality Over Quantity**: Focus on meaningful contributions
3. **Listen to Users**: User feedback is invaluable
4. **Show Appreciation**: Thank contributors publicly
5. **Stay Patient**: Community growth takes time
